zone.line: dead to me, and I felt for a moment
as if he with white hairs were laid
in his coffin and I – youth vanished
in approaching age, were weeping
at his departure timely dissolution.
But it was not so, I was yet young,
Oh! far too young, nor was he dead to
others; but I, most miserable, must
never see or speak to him again. I
must fly from him with more earnest-
ness than from my greatest enemy: in
solitude or in cities I must never
more behold him. That consideration
made me breathless with anguish, and
impressing itself on my imagination
I was unable to fo for a time to follow
up any train of ideas. Ever after this,
I thought, I would live in the most
dreary seclusion. I would retire to the
Continent and become a nun; not
for religion’s sake, for I was not a
Catholic, but that I might be for ever
